Reviews.Title: “Horrific”
Reviews.Author: Navyrae
Reviews.Content: This hostel is absolutely disgusting. The staff is rude and I have honestly never been in a dirtier place. I stayed up all night because I was not going to sleep in that bed. Hell hole. I have another night reserved but I am taking the lose and staying somewhere else. Actually any where else. Do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for lads trip. Not as bad as most of these reviews”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: It has to be said this isn't the best hostel / hotel you will ever stay in, but it's perfect adequate for a guys trip to Amsterdam. We left our booking quite late and The Globe was one of the few hotels near the station with availability. Some of the reviews on trip advisor are terrible so I was a little reluctant to book. However we were pleased with our stay. It is true the Chinese chap on reception is very unhappy with his life. Don't expect a warm weclome on arrival. You won't get it. The other bar staff in the sportsbar were however very friendly. The private 5 bed room we stayed in was clean and the ensuite looked quite new. Despite being in a busy area, all of us had quite a peaceful night sleep. We felt safe at The Globe. The sportsbar food downstairs wasn't bad either. On arriving home I did develop one or two bites on my next (possibly bed bug / nat bites). The best feature about the hotel is that it's really close to the train station and ideally placed for the red light district and coffee shops. You leave the hotel and you're in the thick of the action. I would only recommend the hotel for a lads/stag trip or possibly backpackers. It's probably best not to take your wife/girlfriend here. It does seem pricey for what you get, and there are definitely nicer/cheaper places to stay, but this isn't a bad alternative.

Reviews.Title: “another fantastic stay at the golbal”
Reviews.Author: nellkatka
Reviews.Content: please dont be put off by bad reviews. im not sure what people are looking for when they stay here. its my third time and its eveything you need.cheap, clean, freindly and a great location.thank you globe for looking after us once again. keep up the great work !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hostel”
Reviews.Author: BlueFigh
Reviews.Content: I've read the reviews here and I can't believe people are so negative about this place. I just spent the weekend there with 9 other friends. We have 2 rooms booked. One was for 8 persons and the other for 3 persons. We had private rooms. The bathrooms in the room looked new and worked perfectly. They were clean and well maintained. The rooms were plain and simple with bunk beds in the big room and normal beds in the small rooms. The rooms were clean and there were lockers both in the room and in the corridor (remember to bring your own padlock). The location of this place is perfect. Right in the centre of town, on the edge of the red light district. The reception is at the bar and first impressions might make you feel that this place is a dump. However its not. The staff were polite to me and I had no issues with them. However a friend of mine did say they he would expect better. I guess if you are polite and friendly with them they are likewise with you. I guess this applies everywhere. If you want a relatively cheap place, in the centre of town that is basic but adequate, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty expensive Considering...”
Reviews.Author: Submariner_Nick
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty used and abused, just don't expect too much and you won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: rjmacarthy
Reviews.Content: Don not believe the majority of comments. The Globe is actually pretty decent to stay in. Granted, I did sleep over covers because the weather, but I did get any bed bug bites, and the beds appears to be clean. New shower in our room also. The smoking area is also very good, TV and pool. They also have a quiet area out the back to sit outside over the canal. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “I would rather cut off my left bollock than stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SW18Will
Reviews.Content: Awful awful awful. Booked this on a stag do, knew it was a hostel etc so wasnt expecting to stay at the Ritz. Which was just as well. The dorm had writing on the wall, the lockers were forced and our loo didnt work, something we pointed out to the management but nothing was done about it. Staff not really interested. The location, is fantastic and this is the only good thing to be said. I felt embarrassed that I had booked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs !! Dont stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: 120sas
Reviews.Content: We booked for three nights and only stayed half of one cause we woke up and found bed bugs and alot of them, we demanded our money back and it was a holiday weekend so they just wanted to shut us up. We didn't think we had any bites but they don't show up for 5-10 days and I am covered in them, not only that my bag got infested. So I left it all outside but a couple got in on my clothes and now there in my house, exterminators cost 400$ a room!!! So spend 50â‚¬ and stay somewhere else it's not worth the hassle of dirty bed bugs that don't die!!

Reviews.Title: “the best place in amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: camd123
Reviews.Content: I went with my boyfriend to the globe and it was my best holiday ever. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They even remembered us from our last visit! The food was delicious. The rooms were comfortable. The globe has the best smoking area in amsterdam! Where ever we went we always ended up back at the globe for a few drinks. I would strongly recommend the globe as a place to stay. We will, with out a doubt, be staying there the next time we go to amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “C'mon! I had a great time at The Globe!”
Reviews.Author: Ducon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice, March and May and I will go back. I believe a lot of the criticism is the result one miserable P.O.S. staff member (who, due to archaic Dutch labour laws cannot be let go). Everyone else that I met at The Globe was fantastic. The guys who work the bar are among the nicest I've met anywhere and the girls who work reception are very sweet. And Yu is a champion! I left my mobile there in March and it was waiting for me when I returned 2 months later. If you don't want a dorm, opt for the 6 bed with ensuite and doors that open onto the canal. Very sweet room. Definately not a quiet retreat in the woods but what do you expect when you're staying in the Red Light? The pub is great and has a huge smoking room for.. smoking! Definately a fun place, just ignore the miserable night guy. He'll probably die of unhappiness soon.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BELEIVE EVERYTHING YOU READ ON HERE”
Reviews.Author: clarabelle_W
Reviews.Content: I recently went to the dam on a hen weekend and have to say was a little worried about stopping at the globe judging by the reviews however I have to say they did not reflect my experiance at all. The staff were very helpfull and friendly our room was really nice, it was room 209 (3 bed) the bathroom/wetroom had recently been referbished and the sheets were clean. Our room had french doors opening onto the canal which was great to get some fresh air in. There was no problem with smoke due to the fairly recent smoking ban. There were locks on the doors, over really happy there and would deffinatly stay again and they seemed to be referbing alot of the rooms. Felt very safe when in the hotel also. The bar was great and fairly well priced compaiered to others and there was a pool room which was great. If you are happy to stay in a 20 bed mixed dorm like some of the reviewers on here then what do you expect! I would never choose to share a bedroom and bathroom with 20 other people! Would reccomend to hens, stags, young groups holidays. Great Time had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and full of smoke. Did NOT feel safe.”
Reviews.Author: RN1982
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Globe hostel for one night. We booked 2 beds but the staff gave away one of our beds and still charged us for 2-we arrived at 3am so we had no other choice but to stay there. Everything else was booked along with every other bed in the hostel. The carpets are FILTHY and there was a thick haze of smoke on the top 1/3 of the hallway. All the security cameras in the corners were broken/smashed. As two females traveling by ourselves, we felt VERY unsafe in this place. Spend the extra money and stay someplace else!

Reviews.Title: “Go anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: morsva
Reviews.Content: Awful! Sure, the staff was friendly but not very helpful. That is the best I can say about this place! We, a group of 20, slept in the same room. The toilets was almost okay but the showers was not. Dirty and just an open hole in the ceiling. The place is well placed if you like the rough side of Amsterdam and you are close to the station. And the worst part, they have bed bugs! And a lot of them. And had for years if you go through the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what everyone is complaining about”
Reviews.Author: nejohn
Reviews.Content: Sure, Hotel The Globe was not the best hostel I have ever stayed in but I really don't think it deserves such harsh comments as it has been receiving on this website. The rooms were quite clean, the group of six that I was traveling with felt comfortable walking in our bare feet, the linens and towels were spotless (and, incidentally, beg bug free). There was one guy who worked the front desk one night who was unfriendly and seemed to go out of his way to aggravate people but this was by far made up for by the others who worked there. The day we ate breakfast there, decent again, our server/bartender was really nice and (probably sensing our desperation) gave us a bunch of free coffee refills. The washroom on the first floor was recently renovated and since we were all in a 10-man room and all showered in the morning a bunch of us used the ones in the floor below us -- new, clean, and fully functioning. Apparently one shower on the second floor didn't have hot water. The bar was average, atmosphere-wise but the beer was cheap and the place was opened later than others on weekdays (NOTE: THIS IS NOT A 24-HR BAR LIKE SOME WEBSITES SAY IT IS). The location was absolutely perfect, though, and it was a perfect place for six twenty-something-year-olds to stay for three nights. Look at a couple other websites before taking some of these comments seriously, bed bugs are not even mentioned other than on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Evil-smelling hole!”
Reviews.Author: Pisty
Reviews.Content: This is certainly the worst place I ever stayed! I booked a 10 people dorm with private bathroom, the room was definitely dirty and smelly! And really expensive!!!! We payed 84â‚¬ per person for 2 night! The only positive thing is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Faint of Heart”
Reviews.Author: TheSLCrook
Reviews.Content: The Globe Sports Bar and hotel is purely a money making operation based upon Stag parties and Dirty Weekends. A casual backpacker could do a lot better to find a safer, cleaner, quieter place to stay. The reviews about bedbugs I can't verify as that was not my experience, but the location is in a particularly dodgy area of town, and the hotel is by no means secure. A number of people whom I've met that were staying there had problems with things going missing, including myself. Back before the introduction of the Euro this hotel was a bargain, but now it's not much more than a rip off. Value for the same money can be better had elsewhere. The time I spent there was unforgettable, and a heck of a party. Check out the details on slcrook.blogspot.com

Reviews.Title: “Bare-Bones Hostel, but Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: kylehardgrave
Reviews.Content: This hostel was pretty bare-bones, but fine for a budget traveler. There's free Wi-Fi in the bar downstairs, which also has cheap beer. It's right off the Red Light District, and the staff was very helpful in finding things to do, giving directions, and just helping us get around Amsterdam. No breakfast or any amenity you might associate with a hotel, so the name can be deceiving, but we didn't have any experience with bed bugs, and our stay was generally present and worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “This hostel has bed bugs - BEWARE - FILTHY HELLHOLE”
Reviews.Author: unbiasedmatt
Reviews.Content: I had read the many scathing reviews of this place on Tripadvisor, unfortunately AFTER we had booked our group (it was the only place we could get at such short notice), and so was a bit wary of the hostel. We jokingly reassured ourselves that only moaners put reviews on websites like this. How I wish I had been right! Upon arriving I initially thought the place was OK, after all, this is a backpackers/stag do venue and I fully expected it to be a bit rough and ready: in fact I wanted my trip to have a slightly depraved flavour. The location is very good, right in the heart of Amsterdam, with a lovely canal side terrace, and close to all the bars and filth-emporiums, exactly as any good stag would wish. But when I woke up after the first night to my horror I discovered the bed covered in crawling bed-bugs. All the sheets were spotted with hundreds of red dots where the disgusting things had bitten me. So, the fact that the location is good is utterly irrelevant. DO NOT STAY HERE. You will require fumigation if you do. Two weeks later I am still covered in angry red welts due to allergic reaction to the bites. I look like I have measles, or worse. Some of the other reviewers may have got lucky and avoided the infested rooms, but you would be insane to take the risk. There are other hostels just as cheap and with just as great location - SO DON'T DO IT, or you will regret it!

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: achard87
Reviews.Content: This hostel is disgusting! I've stayed in hostels all over the world, and this is the worst hostel I have ever stayed in. I got bitten by bed bugs and my entire body was covered with the itchiest, most uncomfortable bites. The hostel was dirty, the lockers were not secure, the bathrooms were nasty, and the rooms were very loud. I would not EVER recommend this hostel, I would rather sleep on the streets than in this hostel!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is actually a good place”
Reviews.Author: Jack289
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam with friends, we stayed at this hostel, i must admit, i feared the worst, after reading lots of reviews (mostly bad) i had a lot of doubts. Honestly though, it was fine, it was great fun. Granted there were a few set backs, small dingy rooms/bathrooms but thats about it. The staff were as friendly as they could be, offering us a different room if we wasn't satisfied with ours, its bar is open till 5 so when Amsterdam closes you can stay in there, its a friendly social environment. You're not aloud upstairs without a card so security is good. Personally , i understand everyone has an opinion but i think you make the trip what it is, we took this place in our stride and had a brilliant time in doing so, this hostel is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay the hell away from this infested hell hole!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilgem20
Reviews.Content: I normally would not be too fussy about the state of a hostel/"hotel", your there for the culture and experience of the city all you need is a place to sleep........WELL YOU WON'T GET THAT AT THE GLOBE........................BED BUGS EVERYWHERE!!! I came home COVERED top to toe in itchy red spots, I have to boil all my clothes and bed clothes and my room is off limits I am sleeping on a make shift bed here at home to reduce any possibility of spreading any eggs around, AND I have missed a FULL weeks work which you can not do in the current economic climate!!!I am no snob, far from it, I have stayed in 8euro a night hostels and had a better more hygienic experience. I have slept in some of the most uncomfortable of places e.g sweltering hot bus commuting through thailand and never came home with any sort of skin infections. Thanks to the globe I will be saving my pennies for a little bit of class and quality such as.......clean non-infested beds, a decent shower(lukewarm-went cold when flush water), and electricity(no electricity 3rd night, slept with wet hair) the next time I venture to Amsterdam. I also might add in there that the food made me want to gag, and the guy that made/served it you would swear he hadn't showered in his life I could smell him from the other side of the bar!!! I have never written a review for a hotel/hostel but after this experience I felt compelled to warn others not to stay here. I had a good trip aside from the hostel and when I came home I decided I would bite my lip no matter how bad it was, I wasn't goin to come on line like some moaning oul one, but when I developed the itch the night I came home, and then investigated my body to discover myself COVERED in bites (87 on my calf alone) I just had to do something...........take this warning on board unless you want to sterilize your home and not be able to sleep through the night for days. I am in contact with my doctor and she suggests the spots should be clearing up by now.....................but they are not........she is suggesting I have caught scabies from the beds....... if it is scabies that is ten times worse and the place should be shut down!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY FROM HERE”
Reviews.Author: mother1
Reviews.Content: I booked with the lads here for few nights, I have just walked out and booked into another hotel covered in bed bug bites, I'm itching to hell, was told about other reviews and chose to go with the rest of boys who ignored the reviews.BIG BIG mistake,STAY OUT OF THIS HOLE. I'm off to delouse in a hot shower in good hotel.Not sure what to do with my clothes thou. Don't make same mistake as me, KEEP THE HELL AWAY FROM THE GLOBE. SOrry to the Globe, you really need to deep clean and smarten up.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: littlecaro88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hostel for 3 nights - my second night there, I was taking a nap on one of the bunks, and woke up to find 6 or 7 little black bugs crawling near my face. I didn't know what bed bugs looked like at the time, so I wasn't all that worried. I told the reception before heading out for the night, and the guy at the desk offered me a change of sheets which I could pick up on my way in later that night. First of all, they left me a new blanket (useless), not new sheets. Second, they did not consider that it could be a case of bed bugs (although neither did I, because I didn't know what they looked like), and did not seem nearly as concerned as they should have been. They said bugs sometimes come in from outside, because they're located right on the canal. Right. This happened slightly over a week ago. 2 to 3 days after leaving the hostel, I developed rash-like symptoms on my hands, face, neck and my left hip. I am now covered in bites (30-35 on my left hand, about the same on my right, 6 or 7 on my face and a dozen or so on my back), and I believe I might have brought the bugs home with me. Point being, THIS HOSTEL HAS BED BUGS. At the very least, check your bed/mattress before staying here -- and bed bugs aside, it is a VERY AVERAGE hostel, and way overpriced. Location would be the only positive thing about this place. Never going back.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible on every level”
Reviews.Author: goldentouch77
Reviews.Content: I have just got back from a couple of nights at the globe with 12 friends. We stayed after going to Lowlands festival so we could recharge our batteries before heading home. From start to finish, the experience of the globe was awful. Granted, the location is superb, but then again, so is almost every hostel in Amsterdam. The receptionist spoke in broken english, did not welcome us and only spoke to get our passports, key deposit and to tell us to be out by 10am if we didnt want to pay for an extra night. We had two private rooms, the 8 person one was SMALLER than the 5 person one. The beds were rikerty metal racks with a thin layer of foam on top so you could feel every bar in your back. The entire hostel was grubby and in disrepair. Cleaners seemed to scurry around almost 24 hours a day but whatever they were doing, cleaning was certainly not it. The staff were also rather clueless - I asked several questions about some of the major sights to see in the city - prices, directions, opening times etc. They were unable to answer most questions, and did not suggest were I might find the answers. I ended up googling things myself and then telling them so they might be better able to help future people, to which they seemed somewhat surprised. One of the dutch receptionists was disgustingly rude to me and my girlfriend. When asked if we could leave some lugggage in a cupboard somewhere as our flights were not until the evening, he answered "uh, no, of course not." When I tried to explain that I was hoping he could have been a bit more helfpul as every other hostel I have stayed at in Amsterdam was more than happy to do so, he replied "well pay for an extra night then." When I then said I did not appreciate being spoken to like that, he said "I'm not being rude, if I was being rude, you would know about it." Add to the dirt, rude staff, uncomfortable beds, one of our group had her purse stolen in the downstairs bar within half an hour of being there, the experience was for want of a better word, shocking. If you are a group of students, like we were, looking for the cheapest place - spend an extra Â£5 for a nicer place. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “I considered pitching my tent by the canal outside, it was that bad.”
Reviews.Author: UAT
Reviews.Content: There was only one good thing about the hostel - it's location. Staff were unhelpful & didn't seem to know anything about the main attractions in Amsterdam - every hostel I've been to has had knowledgeable staff, many of whom will go out of the way to help you (at a hostel in Prague the owner gave us his own family card so that we could get in for free. Nothing like that would happen at the Globe). & the man who does night shifts was very rude to our group (all I asked him was whether there was anywhere for us to leave our bags when we checked out. Simple answer = no. He shouted at me for some reason & when I complained the next day the response was "he's been like that for 22 years"). We visited Amsterdam after spending a few days at Lowlands festival. I was cleaner having not washed for a few days than when I got out of one of their showers. The whole place was grubby, especially the communal showers and toilets, despite seeing cleaners there throughout the day. & as we were packing to leave we found things under our beds that didn't belong to us. We always look at reviews before booking hostels, I have no idea why this one seemed to rate pretty highly. Absolutely nothing like the website. It wasn't only my group that hated this place, people we met there were complaining to us how much of a hole it is! No towels were provided, or breakfast or anywhere to store bags after checking out. We had to leave by 10am but our flights weren't until 9 pm - we all had hiking bags & hand luggage. Really inconvienient, especially for a large hostel. Would never recommend this hostel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CummingDubai
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the worst hotel I have stayed in my life. Damp rot on the walls, window seals that leaked. rooms that were never cleaned. And to make things worse it cost as much as a quality hotel. I believe it is going to be closed and gutted, which is the best thing that could happen to it.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: tammybell
Reviews.Content: This is the grimiest hostel i have stayed in, contrary to the pics the hotel has used to advertise itself. The bar/checkin is dark and dingy, the staff are rude and act as if you're wasting their time - for buyin a drink! our room was for 5, the size was ok, but the walls were dirty, and it looked as if some of the sheets hadn't been washed! I didn't shower for 3 days -that explains how bad the bathroom was. Also you could hear everyone that was staying in the hotel through the thin walls. the ONLY good thing about this hostel was the outside smoking area next to the canal.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Hotel EVER..!!”
Reviews.Author: Fishkie
Reviews.Content: Dont even think ov staying here. Ive been to Amsterdam 6 times and go at least once every year. Ive stayed in some shabby hotels, but this HOLE has got to be the worst..!! To make it even worse it was the most EXPENSIVE hotel accom ive paid (the only reason i stayed her is because it was a large party and most had already booked here) It sells itself by having a 24/7 bar, which is good and looks good on the site. But the drinks were over priced and theres no atmosphere. You may aswell wait till like 10am and go somewhere else. We had no electric in our rooms for 3nites..!! When we asked at reseption this was our reply by the fat beast sat at her perch...: Do i look like a electrician?? DO NOT BOOK HERE.

Reviews.Title: “So So Dodgy”
Reviews.Author: eadipus
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 beds in a shared dorm so our expectations weren't too high. Our shared dorm had NO lock on the door and the padlocks supplied by the hostel didn't keep the lockers shut. We asked to be moved and after a lot of pressure and disbelief from the staff that the lockers didn't work we were moved into a different shared dorm. This was an improvement but there is a real shortage of showers/toilets here and they are not at all clean. The location is excellent, right in the red light district and very convenient for the station. Overall, not recomended at all.

Reviews.Title: “Gross accomodations, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nikkim79
Reviews.Content: This place is gross. The mattresses and linens were stained and the bathroom was dirty. We were three girls staying in a mixed dorm with 5 guys- which would have been fine, had one of them not been in his late 40s and slept in the nude. The lack of an age limit is a real problem. If you're a girl, try to get a girls only room-if they have them. Maybe it's the nature of the city, I never had an issue with mixed rooms anywhere else. The staff was really nice though and it's in a good location. It is located on top of a bar- no elevator so be prepared to drag your bags up steep steps. The bar has an outside area along one of the canals, which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great stag do!”
Reviews.Author: seanieboy24
Reviews.Content: First of all this is cheap, friendly and a great location. When we arrived it was easy to locate and checking in was fine. The globe is more of a hostel than hotel so dont be expecting much the bar below is open til 5AM which is great for a stag do. the bedrooms arnt up to much but you get what you pay for and when you are up til 5AM you dont care where you sleep. The location is brilliant it is in the heart of the red light district on the canal with all the local bars close by. i defo recommend for a birthday party or stag do!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ceris80
Reviews.Content: We booked a stay here for 3 nights and after the first night we were forced to ask the management to refund our payment for the next two nights and find an alternative hotel. The rooms were basic and reasonable clean, but there was no central heating which meant that no one got any sleep at all because it was so cold. In addition to this we have a gang of blokes try to break into our room in the middle of the night! We managed to find a really lovely hotel in a good location for only â‚¬10 a night more. Basically if your a gang of lads on a stag weekend, you can probably have a great time here - otherwise avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Rockerfellas
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hostel on three separate occasions. The rooms are basic with a WC and kept clean. If you're on a lads weekend this hostel is for you. It has a 24hr bar which also sells food and shows all the sky footie matches. Its right in the middle of the red light district and has numerous coffee shops and bars steps away. I think the prices are starting to creep up a little due to its popularity but that isn't always a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: finkfloydman
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us recently stayed at the Globe. We are English Ajax supporters who travel quite regularly over for the games. Unfortunately our regular hotel has steadily gone up in price over the last couple of years so it was time to seek out alternative accommodation. So we opted for the globe. Basically you pays your money and get what you get. We paid 20 euro's each per night for a quad room which was on the first floor at the back of the hotel with a small window with absolutely no view whatsoever. The room was very basic but we did have an ensuite shower and toilet which was very handy. The shower had very good water pressure and the water was very hot, unlike some other budget hotels, there was no shower gel or soap supplied. The room was reasonably clean but at the time of writing this there is a lot of pavement work going on right outside the front of the hotel with tons of sand everywhere so the place looks like a beach! Sand had been trampled in all over the hotel including our room. The mattresses on our beds were way past their best and are long overdue to be changed. The bed linen was clean though. The bedroom furniture had seen better days as well but still served it's purpose for us. One thing the room didn't have which I like to have is an in-room safe, so take all your valuables with you. The lock on our door didn't look all that clever so dont leave anything of any value in the room. On a plus note, they serve a wicked breakfast in the bar at a reasonable price and the bar itself is open 24 hours. The hotel is situated right in the red light district and is a stones throw from centraal station, about a three to four minute walk. At the end of the day if you just want somewhere cheap and cheerful just to get your head down (after a long day and hard night) as we did, then you cant go far wrong for the money. However. if you are bringing your wife or girlfriend to Amsterdam for a few days break I would suggest something at little more upmarket. I can recommend the Amstel Botel (3 stars) floating hotel where I have stayed with my wife which offered good value for money. It is also just a stones throw from the station and in fact is not far from the globe. So would we stay at the Globe again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: queso128
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 6-person private room (4 guys 2 girls), which had ensuite shower but shared toilet. Our experience wasn't as bad as some of the reviews, but maybe its because we had a room to ourselves. Most of the clientele appeared to be 20-30 year old guys who probably never ventured out of the red light district. I would not consider for one second staying in a shared dorm here--seems like it could be too rowdy or shady. The room was unexpectedly clean with spotless sheets, and no weird smells. The stairwells/hallways, however, sometimes smelled like marijuana and fried chicken, of which remnants could be found on the floor at at 3am. Pub on ground floor was never an issue with noise. Same with the street--it was at the edge of a canal, a stones throw from the red lights. It was only populated with drinkers during football matches. Staff was anal about security, but thats a necessary inconvenience for staying near the red light district. Only one key per room and we had to leave it with the receptionist when the room was empty. Also, you had to be buzzed in by the staff to get up to the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Cheap few days in 'Dam”
Reviews.Author: Tonka1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel only 5 mins after getting off at Centraal Station. Was booked in and had dumped the bags within another 5 minutes. The price we paid was the price we was quoted, which was nice after previous visits having to stump up extra cash for unknown extra fees. Was a friendly little hotel, nice people behind the bar and Football on the TV, couldnt really ask for anymore to be fair, apart from we didn't realise you couldnt smoke weed in the bar until after we had arrived. All in all I'd say it was a good, budget hotel, recommended for a small groups for short periods.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad points”
Reviews.Author: iloveamsterdammm
Reviews.Content: Firstly the rooms are about as bog-standard as you can get. We stayed for a week and there is only a maid-service before and after your stay which is good in a way as i've never trusted maids. To my disappointment though there are NO towels, only one tea-towel in a room set for 3-4 people?? Therefore as i had overlooked shower towels i had to waste 20euro getting one just to shower with. Small thing but the hotel isnt exactly cheap. The major plus is the 24hr bar which is great as 95% of bars shut at 1pm monday-thurs and 3pm fri-sun, and its very English friendly. The staff are always at hand for good food, drinks and advice. You cannot walk 10 yards without being offered cocaine, ecstacy etc which becomes irritating (if it isnt your thing!) from the men who loiter at every turn. The hotel is at the bottom of one of the red light stretches which is very advantageous for some. Overall yes i would go back but must remember the little things!

Reviews.Title: “Great For Stag do's”
Reviews.Author: LeeHodkinson
Reviews.Content: Was pretty worried about this place by other review but I had not much too worry about in the end. Us 10 guys stayed in 3 rooms (2 3 beds and a 4 beds) all with showers that was hot all day. The rooms seem to be clean enough good sleep. Even though you are on top of a 24hr bar we didn't hear it. There are drug dealers outside on the street but they're not any problem. As you are on the Red Light District of town it does seem to get a little scary after dark and for this it'll probably be better to not to go back by yourselves. The bar was a great place to relax and watch a bit of football and the staff perfect. We stayed for 2 nights here and were getting back about 5am with no trouble of being locked out. Would defiantly recommend it for quick stops or stag do's.

Reviews.Title: “The Pits!!”
Reviews.Author: terry12
Reviews.Content: This place is absolute rock bottom, never hav i been to a place so unclean & only 2 showers & 2 very unclean toilets between about 40 lads is not gud. also if you do ever stay here DO NOT lift the ripped & staind sheets because the matresses are soiled beyond belife (disgusting)also not a safe place to leave any valuables, the room doesent lock & all the lockers have been broken into or had there doors ripped off. GOOD LUCK if you stay here you,ll need it!!...

Reviews.Title: “Never Safe!!”
Reviews.Author: nicofly
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Gloge twice and certainly not again. The first one was but we had a bed each and a shower to share between three, it was cheap considering so I decided to go again. The second time we went we had 12 people sharing 6 bunk beds in 2 rooms with 1 shower between us. When we went to our room after check in there were still 6 lads in all our beds so we had to wait to have them kicked out. If you wernt one of the first up you were guarenteed a cold shower. You had know privacy what so ever, there were no locks on doors and there one of the cleaners kept coming in our room since trying to sell us mushrooms. He also put a replica baretta to one of my friends head whom was only 16 at the time can you imagine that!! Pulled the trigger but didnt put a cap in it so it didnt sound. The rooms were grotty small with one rickety cupboard in which was no use to anyone The bar however was ok and was open pretty much 24hrs. It also showed most sport when it was on. If you like the thought of walking in your digs and still feeling aprehensive and a little uneasy then the Globes for you. However if I were you Id dig a bit deeper in your pockets and stay elewhere for your own sake.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Decent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As long as your not overly picky, this place is alright.We stayed 2 nights in the dorm room and 3 nights in a triple. Nice people, relaxed atmosphere, and a pub that you can get a late night Guinness. Not bad...

Reviews.Title: “LEFT AFTER ONE NIGHT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a dive. Rooms would not lock. No kitchen, no common room. All bathroom lights were broken, paint peeling off walls. Felt unsafe. Stay here only in desperation.

Reviews.Title: “good and cheap”
Reviews.Author: proffitt76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a group of 16 on a stag party. One of the only places that will accept a large group booking. Cheap and the rooms are very basic with bunk beds etc but it is a hostel after all. Shared facilities and the showers are good enough for the job. 10 min walk from the railway station and on a canal at the edge of the red light district (i.e. near enough but not so that you get the freaks hanging about outside), actually quite a pretty location! Sports bar downstairs open almost all the time, beer ok and food ok. In all did the job for minimum cash and rate it. Go here if you are on a party or a student traveller but not if you are a romantic couple.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: most -------- hotel i ever stayed in...but I didnt care, the room was BASIC, with cig burns in the sheets, a rickety old cupboard, a tiny ---window in the corner and a bathroom with a shower straight out of a prison, but a good shower no less.. But like i said it made no difference as we were only in there to sleep. bar was cool, with friendly staff, open 24 hrs, or sometimes till about 5am.. and best of all, about 100 yds away from the heart of the RLD and some of the other attractions, dirt cheap an all...

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere to get your head down!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a base for a stag party/hen night etc., this hotel is perfect, you can get group rooms for very cheap prices, and it's right on the edge of the red light district. The bar is open 24/7, although the pool table is a bit knackered & the brekkie is a bit rough! The rooms are clean & the staff are friendly, & lets face it, after a few joints & fair few Amstel's, no-one really cared that the cold tap on the shower didn't work!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Basic, but clean and reasonably secure. The showers work, and they do a reasonable approximation to a full English breakfast (but no black pudding). For less than 20 euros you get a bunk bed in the centre of town (with a canal view if you're lucky). It's at the quieter end of the RLD, a stone's throw from Central Station - what more do you need? You don't go to the Dam to watch telly or enjoy the use of a sumptious en-suite bathroom do you?Punters are mixed European and North American, with English folk the biggest single group.the downstairs bar is busy and friendly, as are the staff.
